episodeTitle: A Dangerous Love! The Dancer Girl - Violet!
description: Luffy and Franky arrive at the Corrida Colosseum where the Mera Mera no Mi is announced as the tournament prize. Meanwhile, Sanji meets a beautiful dancer named Violet who claims she's in danger, while Zoro searches for his stolen sword.

events.title: Violet's Debut
events.description: Violet, a beautiful flamenco dancer, makes her first appearance in Dressrosa. She approaches Sanji in distress, claiming that she stabbed someone and needs protection from pursuing soldiers.
events.significance: Introduces Violet (Viola), who will play a crucial role in the Dressrosa arc as both a member of the Donquixote Pirates and later an ally to the Straw Hats. Her Devil Fruit ability will prove instrumental in gathering intelligence.

quotes.text: Please, help me! I stabbed a man and now soldiers are after me!
quotes.speaker: Violet
quotes.context: Violet's first words to Sanji, setting up her deceptive approach

events.title: Violet Embraces Sanji
events.description: Violet hugs Sanji tightly to hide from soldiers running past. She asks him to be her bodyguard until they can travel to the next city and requests his help in killing a man.
events.significance: Establishes the initial dynamic between Violet and Sanji, showing her manipulation of his weakness for beautiful women. This sets up the conflict that will later be resolved when she switches sides.

quotes.text: Will you be my bodyguard? I need help getting to the next city... and I need you to help me kill a man.
quotes.speaker: Violet
quotes.context: Violet manipulating Sanji with her request

events.title: Luffy and Franky Arrive at Corrida Colosseum
events.description: Luffy and Franky arrive at the famous Corrida Colosseum, an enormous gladiatorial arena. They are impressed by its grand scale and prepare to enter the tournament being held there.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of the Corrida Colosseum tournament arc, which will introduce numerous characters and lead to Sabo's return. The colosseum becomes a central location for multiple episodes.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's first reaction upon seeing the Corrida Colosseum

events.title: Thunder Soldier Meets Luffy
events.description: The one-legged Thunder Soldier (toy soldier) encounters Luffy and Franky at the Corrida Colosseum entrance. He offers to help them with their luggage and informs them about the tournament competition.
events.significance: First significant interaction between the Thunder Soldier (later revealed to be Kyros) and the Straw Hats. This establishes his role as an informant and ally, crucial for understanding Dressrosa's mysteries.

quotes.text: Let me help you with your luggage! And let me tell you about this tournament...
quotes.speaker: Thunder Soldier
quotes.context: The Thunder Soldier's offer to assist Luffy and Franky

events.title: Mera Mera no Mi Revealed as Tournament Prize
events.description: The tournament announcer dramatically reveals that the legendary Mera Mera no Mi (Flame-Flame Fruit), previously eaten by Portgas D. Ace, will be awarded to the winner of the Corrida Colosseum tournament. The crowd erupts in excitement.
events.significance: This revelation creates enormous emotional stakes for Luffy and drives the entire Corrida Colosseum arc. The fruit's connection to Ace makes it deeply personal for Luffy, while also serving as Doflamingo's bait to disrupt the Straw Hat-Law alliance. This leads to Sabo's eventual acquisition of the fruit.

quotes.text: I want that fruit! I have to get it!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's emotional reaction upon seeing Ace's Devil Fruit

events.title: Cavendish's Debut
events.description: Cavendish, the beautiful and narcissistic pirate known as 'Cavendish of the White Horse' and 'The Pirate Prince', makes his debut appearance. His striking looks cause people around him to faint, and he's immediately established as a major contender in the tournament.
events.significance: Introduces Cavendish, who will become a significant character in the Dressrosa arc and eventually a captain in the Straw Hat Grand Fleet. His dual personality with Hakuba adds complexity to his character and provides crucial assistance during the battle against Doflamingo.

quotes.text: I am Cavendish, the most beautiful pirate on the seas!
quotes.speaker: Cavendish

events.title: Multiple Gladiator Debuts
events.description: The announcer introduces various gladiators who will compete in the tournament. While many appear as silhouettes or brief cameos, several notable fighters are shown including members of the Donquixote Pirates (Senor Pink, Dellinger), various kingdom representatives (Elizabello II, Dagama), and other powerful competitors (Sai, Chinjao, Bobby Funk, Suleiman, Abdullah, Jeet, Orlumbus).
events.significance: Sets up the massive scale of the tournament with 556 participants, many of whom will become significant characters. Several will later join the Straw Hat Grand Fleet, while others represent important kingdoms and organizations in the One Piece world.

events.title: Zoro Uses Observation Haki
events.description: Zoro searches for his stolen sword and uses his Observation Haki to track down the fairy who took it, demonstrating his improved haki abilities post-timeskip.
events.significance: Shows Zoro's continued mastery of haki and introduces the fairy subplot that will reveal the existence of the Tontatta Tribe and their involvement with the Straw Hats' mission in Dressrosa.

events.title: Tournament Rules and Structure Explained
events.description: The tournament structure is revealed: the competition will be divided into blocks (A, B, C, and D), with 556 total participants competing. The winner of each block will advance to the finals, with the ultimate victor claiming the Mera Mera no Mi.
events.significance: Establishes the framework for multiple episodes of tournament action, allowing for the introduction and development of numerous characters who will become important allies and members of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet.

events.title: Doflamingo's Trap Setup
events.description: It becomes clear that the Mera Mera no Mi tournament is orchestrated by Doflamingo as a trap to lure Luffy and disrupt his alliance with Law. Franky recognizes this may be a ploy but agrees they cannot pass up the opportunity.
events.significance: Reveals Doflamingo's strategic thinking and his attempt to manipulate Luffy's emotional attachment to Ace. This setup drives the conflict for the entire Dressrosa arc and demonstrates how Doflamingo uses psychological warfare against his enemies.

quotes.text: This may be a ploy by Doflamingo, but it's not a situation we should pass.
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky recognizing the danger but understanding the importance of the fruit

quotes.text: I want that fruit! I have to get it!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's emotional reaction upon seeing Ace's Devil Fruit as the tournament prize

quotes.text: Please, help me! I stabbed a man and now soldiers are after me!
quotes.speaker: Violet

quotes.text: This may be a ploy by Doflamingo, but it's not a situation we should pass.
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Recognizing the trap but understanding the importance

quotes.text: I am Cavendish, the most beautiful pirate on the seas!
quotes.speaker: Cavendish
quotes.context: Cavendish's narcissistic introduction at the colosseum

themes.description: The episode heavily emphasizes Ace's legacy through the Mera Mera no Mi, forcing Luffy to confront his brother's death while also honoring his memory by seeking to protect his power.
themes.symbolism: The Mera Mera no Mi serves as a physical manifestation of Ace's spirit and legacy, creating emotional weight for Luffy and viewers alike.

themes.description: Violet's manipulation of Sanji introduces themes of deception in Dressrosa, a country where nothing is as it seems. This mirrors the larger deception Doflamingo has perpetrated on the entire island.
themes.symbolism: Violet's beautiful appearance hiding her true intentions parallels Dressrosa's beautiful surface hiding its dark reality.

themes.description: The Corrida Colosseum represents traditional gladiatorial combat and honor through strength, with fighters from across the world gathering to prove their worth.
themes.symbolism: The colosseum itself symbolizes the competitive nature of the pirate world and the quest for power.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy faces an emotional moment seeing Ace's Devil Fruit and must decide whether to enter the tournament to honor his brother's memory and prevent the fruit from falling into the wrong hands.
keyActions: Arrives at Corrida Colosseum with Franky
Sees the Mera Mera no Mi revealed as prize
Declares his intention to win the tournament
quotes: I want that fruit! I have to get it!

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a mysterious dancer who approaches Sanji for help, though her true allegiance to the Donquixote Pirates is hidden. Her manipulative nature and beauty make her a perfect tool for Doflamingo's plans.
keyActions: First appearance as a flamenco dancer
Approaches Sanji claiming to be in danger
Embraces Sanji to hide from soldiers
Requests Sanji's help as a bodyguard and assassin
quotes: Please, help me! I stabbed a man and now soldiers are after me!

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji's weakness for beautiful women is exploited by Violet, setting up his subplot in Dressrosa where his chivalry will be tested and ultimately vindicated when Violet switches sides.
keyActions: Agrees to help Violet despite the suspicious circumstances

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a narcissistic and beautiful pirate with immense pride. His character establishes him as both a potential rival and future ally to Luffy.
keyActions: Causes onlookers to faint with his beauty
quotes: I am Cavendish, the most beautiful pirate on the seas!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime showed specific gladiator participants instead of silhouettes. In the manga, when Gatz talked about the gladiators, generic silhouettes were used, but the anime revealed characters like Cavendish, Senor Pink, Dellinger, and others.
Additional scenes of Zoro using Observation Haki to track the fairy were added, expanding on the brief manga mention.
Restaurant interactions and Kin'emon's search subplot were expanded with additional dialogue and scenes.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the debut of Viola/Violet, voiced by Mie Sonozaki in Japanese and Cristina Valenzuela in English. Valenzuela is known for voicing many anime characters including Homura Akemi in Madoka Magica.
The Corrida Colosseum is based on real gladiatorial arenas, particularly the Roman Colosseum and Spanish bullfighting rings, fitting with Dressrosa's Spanish cultural influences.
This episode adapted Chapter 702 (pages 12-15) and Chapter 703 (pages 3-15) from the manga, covering approximately 1.3 chapters worth of content.
The opening theme 'Wake up!' by AAA was specifically created for the Dressrosa arc and ran for 58 episodes (629-686), one of the longer-running openings in One Piece history.
Episode 632 introduced 13 character debuts in a single episode (as silhouettes or cameos), one of the highest debut counts for a single One Piece episode.
Starting with episode 279 (December 2006), One Piece discontinued ending themes to allow for longer opening sequences and more episode content. Episode 632 follows this format with no ending theme.
